Underwater cities could be built and explored, leading to a new era of urban development and expansion.
Marine life would become more accessible and studied, leading to new discoveries and conservation efforts.
Aquatic sports and recreational activities would become more popular, leading to the development of new equipment and technologies.
Communication and transportation systems would be revolutionized, with underwater cables and pipelines becoming commonplace.
Our understanding of the ocean and its ecosystems would be greatly expanded, leading to new scientific discoveries and advancements in fields such as biology, geology, and oceanography.
